content.description: This is one of the many great routes on this boulder. Find the obvious Z flake on the back of the boulder, and start at the bottom right of it. Traverse left and then up and right, and then finish and top out on some jugs! It is a very fun route on steep rock!
content.location:
On the back of the boulder, around the corner from

Petrified Prow

.

content.description: Start where the rock becomes concave to the right of three finger pocket, traverse left.
content.location: This is on the Petrified Boulder.

content.description:
This is one of the cooler climbs at Sailing Hawks.  The three finger pocket is far right in the picture while other unknown routes twist left.

Start from a sit down and left of the prow and pocket. Move up and right to the pocket and continue up the prow to the top.
content.location: This problem is the prow at the right end of the main 45 degree face of the Petrified Boulder, after the prow the wall stays steep but not as steep.

content.description: Sit start on an obvious flake, work through the cobbled bulge with an undercling, and throw to a very painful sidepull. It has a gratifying topout.
content.location:
This is right of

Petrified Arete

next to Al Montana.

content.description:
"Seams Easy" starts to the left of

Three Finger Pocket/Petrified Prow

.  Sit start with your right hand on a juggy ear and left hand on the sloping edge that is almost flat, then do an iron cross move to a juggy but hard to reach gaston.  Climb up the seam to the top of the Petrified Boulder.  Drink a tecate and don't forget to pack your trash out of Sailing Hawks.  ENJOY!
content.location:
"Seams Easy" starts to the left of

Three Finger Pocket/Petrified Prow

and climbs over the rock sticking out of the ground directly left to the start of the problem.

content.description: Sit start on jugs. Work your way up before traversing out of the small roof and over the lip using cool pinches.
content.location:
It is on the far right side of Petrified Boulder and starts under the roof about 20 feet looker's right of

Three Finger Pocket

.

content.description: Sit-start and pull up on jugs the whole way.
content.location:
It is in the middle of the face, just left of

Three Finger Pocket

.

content.description:
Climb the arete from a sit start. When turning onto the slab at the top, please try to avoid grabbing the small tree as this will eventually kill it. Finish up the slab at the top.

TREE IS OFF
content.location: This is the far left arete on the North face of the Petrified Boulder from a sit start.

content.description: Start on the obvious jug down low (it could break soon, be light). Do some cool, flowy moves to a right hand move to a sharp pocket which leads to a powerful move to a crimp up and left. Hit the jug at the lip. This could be considered slightly contrived and sharp but is a worthy problem with pretty sweet movement. Enjoy the Sailing Hawks benchmark V8.
content.location:
Global Warming is located 2 climbs to the right of

Petrified Arete

and one climb to the right of Al Montana.

content.description:
Sit start right of "

Three Finger Pocket/Petrified Prow

", work up to large sidepull, and make move up left to the lip.
content.location: It is on the Petrified Boulder.
